byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and GAIA PIANIGIANI
byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Rome, and Gaia Pianigiani from Siena, Italy.

lead_paragraph: Europe was again confronted with the horrors of its refugee crisis during a deadly three-day stretch on the sea, which is becoming a more popular migrant route.

headline.print_headline: 3 Days, 700 Dead: Sea’s Heavy Toll in Migrant Crisis
headline.main: Three Days, 700 Deaths on Mediterranean as Migrant Crisis Flares

snippet: Europe was again confronted with the horrors of its refugee crisis during a deadly three-day stretch on the sea, which is becoming a more popular migrant route.
abstract: Three boats carrying migrants capsize on Mediterranean Sea in three days, killing at least 700 people and highlighting Europe's refugee crisis as both tourism and human smuggling seasons ramp up for summer; wrecks bring year's total to over 2,000 migrant deaths, on track to surpass 2015 tally of over 3,700; closing of Greek borders has shifted focus to riskier route from Libya to Italy.
